title.label: Hook! Hook! Rocket jump! Pant slide!

content.label:
One of my favorite games is back! Very intuitive controls. Tap the right side of the screen to time your grapple hook grabs to move forward. Tap the boots on the bottom of the screen to save yourself from a never ending fall. This game is perfectly built for a touch screen. I love collecting all of the extra hooks and hats in their beautiful Super Nintendo style, 16bit glory. A little dash of humor and a nice variety to levels along with a never ending ‚ÄòAvalanche‚Äô mode offer a ton of replay value. 
Thanks Game Club for bringing one of the all time greats back!

I am so happy to see this game up and running again! I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd be able to play it again and I was bummed that it hadn‚Äôt been updated in years. It‚Äôs so charming and fun to play. There are a few bugs that need fixing but other than that it‚Äôs working great.
This was my favorite game :(
One of the absolute best iOS games of all time. I periodically think about it, in fact, and find myself wishing I could play it again. Would also PAY for it again.

I love rocket cat's games, but they've left their legacy of iPhone games in a mostly unplayable state, with no updates. Don't take customers money selling them a broken game. Pretty scummy.

title.label: Too bad. It could have been amazing

content.label: But this game is obviously abandonware because it absolutely will not save any progress and judging from the reviews it's been a problem for a long time. I was hoping that the reviews were overstating it but you simply cannot play this game without sheer frustration in the amount of data that gets lost  every time you exit the game. I'll be getting my money back despite loving this game when it works.

I FINALLY finished the second-toughest level in the game. I quit out the game to take a break. When I came back, I had lost almost all of my progress. The game was a blast and I had a lot of fun, but this mishap makes it not worth buying. Will change review if patch is released.
The game is fun but won't save any progress or items bought in the store. Very frustrating. I'm a paying customer. This needs to be fixed ASAP.

Update: won't save progress on my iPhone 6 running 8.3. I know Rocketcat is busy, but a patch would be appreciated.

title.label: Wonderful game, but watch out for data loss

content.label: I've loved this game for years, and downloaded it again very recently. However, with OpenFeint gone, the game's become borderline unplayable! None of my game saves, so I have to constantly start over from where I was a long while back. That being said, there's a ton of very tough, very polished content, and it's well worth the money. I wholly recommend it, but do watch out for losses of save data

If you enjoyed Hook Champ, you'll enjoy this - but I feel Hook Champ is superior in the following ways:
* There was steady improvement (equipment wise) as you advanced.  In SQH, I had every performance upgrade before I had started the third set of levels.  I can blame this, unfortunately, on the glitch that forced me to get 2000 points in Avalanche mode before advancing.
* Hook Champ had an actual story; this started to have one but does not continue it through out the levels.  I had hoped I would be playing as the hermit, trying to find a new place to live - but instead I'm some lame guy without a story.

* Hook Champ had a better graphical style, imo - though this is subjective; they both have a fairly retro style, but Hook Champ is dark and mysterious whereas this is bright and fun.
* Hook Champ had awesome dialogue.
* Hook Champ had an awesome shopkeeper.

The awesome things about SQH are:
* that it's an awesome Grappling Hook game
* More levels of Hook Champ (though, like I said, the game play is a bit different)
* That it's faster, but not too fast
* A randomized level that resets on every play
* A fun game that you can play for a few minutes
* The awesome dialogue (there's tons: I still haven't run out and I've been playing since release) in the shop

On that note - I would prefer if the avalanche did not reset after each run - doing that would actually allow for more exploration.  I'd also like a randomized level without the time constraints.

I also wish the game didn't have the glitches when it starts up.  If I have too many programs running in the background, some levels (ZigZag Horror, for example) are unplayable, even with the settings turned down.

I'm looking forward to Update 3!

I loved Hook Champ; I completed all the levels, got all but the very last forbidden hat, and even bought the two extra characters. Eventually, I got bored. I have now moved onto Super QuickHook, and I think I will be playing it for quite a while! The hats, hooks, characters, and dialogue are as great as (if not better than) Hook Champ, and Avalanche/ Eruption mode offers endless challenge!
But the last update was almost a year ago. Can't u at least submit the patch for the loading bug on avalanche mode?
This is still my all-time favorite game on the iPhone. Highest recommendation.
